nodes.excerpt: Introduction to the CQRS Pattern CQRS splits things up: one model for commands (writes), another for queries (reads). Your read side can beâ€¦

frontmatter.title: CQRS - Split Personality Disorder for Your Data (And Why That's Actually Good)
frontmatter.description: Ever notice how trying to optimize for both reading and writing data gets messy? CQRS solves this by splitting them into separate models, each doing what it does best without compromising the other.

nodes.excerpt: This post is a summary with some of my personal opinions on this post on Reddit - Why "composition over inheritance" is still hard in Câ€¦

frontmatter.title: Is â€œComposition over Inheritanceâ€ Hard in C#?
frontmatter.description: Exploring why C# makes inheritance effortless with simple syntax while composition requires extensive boilerplate code for method delegation.
